home.title: Vihar Raksha Tap
home.subtitle: The pure purpose of the tap is clear in its name itself.
home.intro: The monks and nuns in the reign of the last Tirthankara continuously travel during the eight months outside of Chaturmas.
home.content1: The revered ones who travel from village to village
home.content1Bold: bring welfare to the souls of many beings
home.content2: Through travel, they provide guidance during festivals.
home.content3: Through travel, the revered Guru Bhagwants provide guidance in many villages and cities for
home.content4: They conduct various aradhanas in different Sanghs.
home.content5: When the monks and nuns are traveling, all these aradhana-prabhavana and shasan-raksha activities happen. The day travel stops, everything stops. This is understandable.
home.content6: As soon as the Chaturmas of monks and nuns ends and travel begins,
home.content7: Our worldly vehicle usage has become such. This is known to all.
home.content7Bold: Till date, we have lost hundreds of monks and nuns through accidents. This is our misfortune.
home.content8: Stopping travel is never appropriate and stopping our vehicle usage doesn't seem possible. Therefore,
home.content8Bold: we need to accumulate such merit through tap-aradhana
home.content9: With such an auspicious thought, we want to start this auspicious, obstacle-removing Ayambil tap.
home.content10: The aspiration is that Shri Sangh joins this tap and through unparalleled devotion to the revered ones, brings welfare to their own soul.
